alert.note: Alert for Butler; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:57PM CDT until June 01 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Butler County in south central Kansas... Northern Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... Western Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 500 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 1057 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Eureka, Fredonia, Yates Center, Howard, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Rosalia, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Fall River Lake, Fall River State Park, Cross Timbers State Park, Toronto Lake and Eureka Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
